The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the spell. Each time you Sustain the spell, you can choose one of four options.

- **Cook** Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
- **Lift** Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
- **Make** Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile—it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
- **Tidy** Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object takes 1 minute per Bulk.

Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the spell.

entity.name: Produce Flame
entity.summary: A flickering flame in your hand that can be hurled as a ranged attack.
entity.description:
A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it. Make a ranged spell attack roll against your target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but you can also make a melee attack if a creature is within your reach. On a success, you deal 1d4 fire damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier. On a critical success, the target takes double damage plus 1d4 persistent fire damage.

**Heightened (+1)** The initial damage increases by 1d4, and the persistent fire damage on a critical success increases by 1d4.

entity.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
entity.summary: Enfeeble a creature to reduce its physical power.
entity.description:
A ray of sickly energy weakens the target. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target becomes enfeebled 2.

Critical Success: The target is enfeebled 3.
Success: The target is enfeebled 2.

entity.name: Ray of Frost
entity.summary: Blast a creature with cold, dealing damage and slowing it down.
entity.description:
You blast an icy ray. Make a ranged spell attack roll.

**Critical Success** The target takes 2d4 cold damage and takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.
**Success** The target takes 1d4 cold damage and takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.

**Heightened (+1)** The damage on a success increases by 1d4, and the damage on a critical success increases by 2d4.

entity.name: Read Aura
entity.summary: Read the magic aura of an item to identify its properties.
entity.description:
You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn its school of magic, its rarity, and the tradition of magic it carries (if it has a magic tradition).

If the object has an illusion aura but is not actually an illusion, you learn that it has an illusion aura but can't tell what tradition the illusion spell is from. An object bearing a misleading aura can confound this spell, depending on the rank of the aura.

**Heightened (3rd)** You can target up to 10 objects.
**Heightened (6th)** You can target any number of objects.

entity.name: Resist Energy
entity.summary: A shield of elemental energy protects a creature.
entity.description: A shield of elemental energy protects a creature against one type of energy damage. Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. The target gains resistance 5 against the chosen energy type. The resistance increases to 10 at 7th rank and to 15 at 9th rank.

entity.name: Restoration
entity.summary: Restorative magic counters the effects of toxins or conditions.
entity.description:
Restorative magic counters the effects of toxins or conditions that prevent a creature from functioning at its best. When you cast restoration, choose to either reduce a condition or lessen the effect of a toxin. A creature can benefit from only one restoration spell each day, and it can't benefit from restoration more than once to reduce the stage of the same exposure to a given toxin.

Reduce a Condition: Reduce the value of the target's clumsy, enfeebled, or stupefied condition by 2. You can instead reduce two of the listed conditions by 1 each.

Lessen a Toxin: Reduce the stage of one toxin the target suffers from by one stage. This can't reduce the stage below stage 1 or cure the affliction.

entity.name: Sanctuary
entity.summary: Protect a creature from hostile actions.
entity.description:
You ward a creature with a protective aura. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.

Critical Success: The attacker can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.
Success: The attacker can't attack the target and wastes the action. The attacker can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.
Failure: As success, and the attacker is frightened 1.
Critical Failure: As success, and the attacker is frightened 2.

entity.name: Scorching Ray
entity.summary: You fire a ray of heat and flame at a creature.
entity.description: You fire a ray of heat and flame. Make a spell attack roll against a single creature. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, you can fire an additional ray at a different target, to a maximum of three rays targeting three different targets for 3 actions. These attacks each increase your multiple attack penalty, but you don't increase your multiple attack penalty until after you make all the spell attack rolls for scorching ray. If you spend 2 or more actions Casting the Spell, the damage increases to 4d6 fire damage on a hit, and it increases to 6d6 fire damage if you spend 3 actions.

entity.name: Searing Light
entity.summary: You shoot a blazing ray of light at a foe.
entity.description:
You shoot a blazing ray of light tinged with holy energy. Make a ranged spell attack roll. The ray deals 5d6 fire damage. If the target is a fiend or undead, you deal an extra 5d6 spirit damage.

Critical Success: The target takes double damage.

Success: The target takes full damage.

entity.name: See the Unseen
entity.summary: You gain the ability to see invisible creatures and objects.
entity.description: You gain the ability to see invisible creatures and objects. They appear to you as translucent shapes, though they might still be concealed to you due to other factors, such as being hidden behind an object. You can also see incorporeal creatures and objects, though they appear even more translucent.

entity.name: Shield
entity.summary: A shield of magical force blocks attacks and can be sacrificed to save you from damage.
entity.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is active, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After the shield takes damage, the spell ends and you can't cast shield again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use this spell's reaction against the magic missile spell.

Heightening the spell increases the Hardness.

**Heightened (3rd)** The shield has Hardness 10.
**Heightened (5th)** The shield has Hardness 15.
**Heightened (7th)** The shield has Hardness 20.

entity.name: Shocking Grasp
entity.summary: Zap a creature with an electrified touch attack.
entity.description:
You shroud your hands in a crackling field of lightning. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 2d12 electricity damage. If the target is wearing metal armor or is made of metal, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll with shocking grasp, and the target also takes 1d4 persistent electricity damage on a hit.

Critical Success: The target takes double damage and is stunned 1.
Success: The target takes full damage.

entity.name: Slow
entity.summary: You slow the targets' flow of time.
entity.description:
You slow the targets' flow of time. Each target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success: The target is unaffected.

Success: The target is slowed 1 for 1 round.

Failure: The target is slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure: The target is slowed 2 for 1 minute.

entity.name: Soothe
entity.summary: Calm emotions and heal mental damage.
entity.description: You grace the target's mind, healing mental damage and soothing mental anguish. The target regains 1d10+4 Hit Points. You also attempt to counteract fear effects on the target.

entity.name: Spider Sting
entity.summary: Inject a creature with toxic venom.
entity.description:
You magically duplicate the venomous sting of a spider. You deal 1d4 piercing damage to the touched creature and afflict it with spider venom. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success: The target is unaffected.
Success: The target takes 1d4 poison damage.
Failure: The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 1.
Critical Failure: The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 2.

Spider Venom (poison); Level 1. Maximum Duration 4 rounds; Stage 1 1d4 poison damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round); Stage 2 1d4 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round).

entity.name: Spiritual Weapon
entity.summary: A weapon made of pure magical force manifests and attacks foes.
entity.description: A weapon made of pure magical force manifests and attacks foes you designate within range. This weapon has a reach of 5 feet. When you Cast the Spell, you make a melee spell attack roll against a creature within the weapon's reach. On a hit, the weapon deals 2d8 force damage. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the Strike. The weapon has the traits you choose when you cast the spell, either those of a sword or those of your deity's favored weapon.

entity.name: Stabilize
entity.summary: Stabilize a dying creature.
entity.description: Positive energy shuts death's door. The target loses the dying condition, though it remains unconscious at 0 Hit Points.

entity.name: Stinking Cloud
entity.summary: A cloud of foul-smelling gas nauseates creatures within it.
entity.description: You create a 20-foot burst of foul-smelling, yellow-green fog. The cloud doesn't block vision but creatures within it are concealed. Creatures that start their turn in the cloud or enter it must attempt a Fortitude save or become sickened 1 (sickened 2 on a critical failure). Creatures in the cloud also take a -2 circumstance penalty to Fortitude saves against disease and inhaled poisons.

entity.name: Telekinetic Projectile
entity.summary: Fling an object at a creature.
entity.description:
You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target. If you hit, the object deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage, plus your spellcasting ability modifier. If the object is a weapon, you deal the weapon's damage instead.

**Critical Success** You deal double damage, plus an additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage.
**Success** You deal full damage.

**Heightened (+1)** The damage from the object increases by 1d6.

entity.name: True Strike
entity.summary: Gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your next attack roll.
entity.description: A flash of insight into the future ensures your next strike finds its target. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being concealed or hidden.
entity.duration: until the end of your turn

entity.name: Vampiric Touch
entity.summary: Your touch deals void damage and heals you.
entity.description: Your touch leeches the lifeblood out of a target to empower yourself. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a success, you deal 6d6 void damage and the target becomes drained 1. On a critical success, the target becomes drained 2 instead. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to half the void damage the target takes (after applying resistances and the like). You lose any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

entity.name: Wall of Wind
entity.summary: You create a barrier of gusting winds.
entity.description: You create a barrier of gusting winds that hinders anything trying to pass through. The wall of wind is 5 feet thick, up to 50 feet long, and up to 20 feet high. The wall stands vertically, but you can shape its path. Ranged attacks passing through the wall have a DC 5 flat check to determine whether they're deflected back at the attacker. The wind disperses gas and mist, and it makes fires larger on the side the wind is blowing toward. Tiny or smaller creatures that attempt to pass through the wall must succeed at a Fortitude save or be pushed 10 feet away from the wall (20 feet on a critical failure).

entity.name: Water Breathing
entity.summary: The targets can breathe underwater.
entity.description: The targets can breathe underwater and can't drown. This doesn't give them the ability to swim, nor does it grant any protection against water pressure or other environmental hazards of being underwater. If you cast this spell on a creature that can't breathe air, it gains the ability to breathe air instead of water.

entity.name: Breastplate
entity.summary: Metal chest plate providing heavy armor protection for vital areas.
entity.description:
This heavy metal chest piece is worn with leather straps and padding underneath. Though it protects only the torso, it provides substantial protection to vital areas while allowing good arm mobility.

- AC Bonus: +4
- Dex Cap: +1
- Check Penalty: -2
- Speed Penalty: -5 ft
- Strength: 16
- Group: Plate
- Armor Traits: —

A breastplate is a single piece of sculpted metal that covers the torso. It can be worn with other armor pieces like greaves and vambraces to provide additional protection.

entity.name: Buckler
entity.summary: Small metal shield strapped to the forearm, providing minimal defense without hindering weapon use.
entity.description:
This very small shield is a metal disk with a central grip that is typically strapped to your forearm. Bucklers don't provide the same defensive benefits as larger shields, but they can be used while your hands are occupied.

- AC Bonus: +1 (when Raised)
- Speed Penalty: 0 ft
- Hardness: 3
- HP (BT): 6 (3)

A buckler can't be used with the Shield Block reaction. You can Raise a Shield with your buckler as long as you have that hand free or are holding a light object that's not a weapon in that hand. Unlike other shields, you can use the hand covered by a buckler for other things, but because it's strapped to your forearm, you can't hold anything in that hand.

entity.name: Chain Mail
entity.summary: Full suit of interlocking metal rings providing comprehensive medium armor protection.
entity.description:
This full suit of chain mail consists of interlocking metal rings that cover the entire body. It's worn over padding to prevent chafing and distribute the weight more comfortably.

- AC Bonus: +4
- Dex Cap: +1
- Check Penalty: -2
- Speed Penalty: -5 ft
- Strength: 16
- Group: Chain
- Armor Traits: flexible, noisy

Chain mail is made of interlocking metal rings. It's included in the plate armor group for purposes of critical specialization effects. The flexible trait means you can use your full Dexterity modifier on Reflex saves. The noisy trait imposes a -1 penalty to Stealth checks.

entity.name: Chain Shirt
entity.summary: Lightweight chain mail covering the torso, offering flexible medium armor protection.
entity.description:
This shirt of chain mail, sometimes called a byrnie, is lighter than full chain mail and covers only the torso. It's commonly worn over padding or leather for additional comfort.

- AC Bonus: +2
- Dex Cap: +3
- Check Penalty: -1
- Speed Penalty: 0 ft
- Strength: 12
- Group: Chain
- Armor Traits: flexible, noisy

A chain shirt is a light mesh of metal rings covering the torso. The flexible trait means you can use your full Dexterity modifier on Reflex saves. The noisy trait imposes a -1 penalty to Stealth checks.

entity.name: Explorer's Clothing
entity.summary: Durable clothing favored by adventurers, providing minimal protection but maximum mobility.
entity.description:
This comfortable set of durable clothing is favored by adventurers who want to look professional without sacrificing mobility. Explorer's clothing provides a small amount of protection while allowing you to move freely.

- AC Bonus: +0
- Dex Cap: +5
- Check Penalty: 0
- Speed Penalty: 0 ft
- Strength: —
- Group: Cloth
- Armor Traits: comfort

Explorer's clothing includes shirts, pants, gloves, and a jacket or cloak that provides a small amount of protection. The comfort trait means this armor is so comfortable you can rest normally while wearing it.

entity.name: Full Plate
entity.summary: Complete suit of shaped and fitted metal plates providing maximum heavy armor protection.
entity.description:
This complete suit of armor is carefully crafted from shaped and fitted metal plates. The plates are joined and held in place with leather straps and rivets. Full plate provides the best protection available, though it is heavy and expensive.

- AC Bonus: +6
- Dex Cap: +0
- Check Penalty: -3
- Speed Penalty: -10 ft
- Strength: 18
- Group: Plate
- Armor Traits: bulwark

Full plate consists of a complete suit of interlocking and overlaying metal plates, including gauntlets, heavy leather boots, and a visored helmet. The bulwark trait lets you use your Strength modifier in place of your Dexterity modifier on Reflex saves, but only if your Strength modifier is higher.

entity.name: Half Plate
entity.summary: Shaped metal plates covering upper body and legs with heavy armor protection.
entity.description:
Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in full plate, with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This armor provides outstanding protection while being somewhat more affordable than full plate.

- AC Bonus: +5
- Dex Cap: +1
- Check Penalty: -3
- Speed Penalty: -10 ft
- Strength: 16
- Group: Plate
- Armor Traits: —

Half plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and a breastplate and other metal plates covering most of the body. The joints are protected by chainmail or leather.

entity.name: Hide Armor
entity.summary: Thick animal hides provide substantial medium armor protection.
entity.description:
Made from thick animal hide, this armor is favored by barbarians and those who live close to nature. The thick layers provide excellent protection, though they can be somewhat restrictive.

- AC Bonus: +3
- Dex Cap: +2
- Check Penalty: -2
- Speed Penalty: -5 ft
- Strength: 14
- Group: Leather
- Armor Traits: —

Hide armor is made from the tanned skin of particularly thick-hided animals, stitched with either multiple overlapping layers of crude leather or exterior pieces of leather stuffed with padding or fur.

entity.name: Leather Armor
entity.summary: Boiled leather provides reliable light armor protection for agile combatants.
entity.description:
This suit of leather armor consists of multiple pieces of boiled or treated leather, carefully sewn together to provide protection without hindering movement. It's a popular choice for rogues and other agile warriors.

- AC Bonus: +1
- Dex Cap: +4
- Check Penalty: -1
- Speed Penalty: 0 ft
- Strength: 10
- Group: Leather
- Armor Traits: —

Leather armor is made from boiled or specially treated leather. It provides good protection while still allowing for excellent mobility.

entity.name: Padded Armor
entity.summary: Quilted layers of cloth provide basic protection while remaining light and comfortable.
entity.description:
This suit of armor consists of heavy, quilted layers of cloth with some light padding. It provides modest protection while remaining relatively lightweight and comfortable to wear.

- AC Bonus: +1
- Dex Cap: +3
- Check Penalty: 0
- Speed Penalty: 0 ft
- Strength: 10
- Group: Cloth
- Armor Traits: comfort

Padded armor is made of quilted layers of cloth and batting. The comfort trait means this armor is so comfortable you can rest normally while wearing it.

entity.name: Scale Mail
entity.summary: Overlapping metal scales provide solid medium armor protection.
entity.description:
Scale mail consists of many metal scales sewn onto a backing of leather or sturdy cloth. The overlapping scales provide excellent protection while allowing reasonable movement.

- AC Bonus: +3
- Dex Cap: +2
- Check Penalty: -2
- Speed Penalty: -5 ft
- Strength: 14
- Group: Composite
- Armor Traits: —

Scale mail is made of dozens of small overlapping metal plates. Each suit is a unique design, with different patterns of overlapping metal.

entity.name: Splint Mail
entity.summary: Strips of metal riveted to backing provide extensive heavy armor coverage.
entity.description:
This suit of armor consists of narrow vertical metal plates riveted to a backing of leather or cloth. The overlapping strips provide excellent protection while still allowing movement.

- AC Bonus: +5
- Dex Cap: +1
- Check Penalty: -3
- Speed Penalty: -10 ft
- Strength: 16
- Group: Plate
- Armor Traits: —

Splint mail consists of metal strips (splints) attached to a backing of leather or sturdy fabric. This armor provides significant protection at the cost of considerable weight and restricted movement.

entity.name: Steel Shield
entity.summary: Durable metal shield providing superior defense and damage resistance.
entity.description:
This sturdy metal shield is crafted from steel, making it significantly more durable than its wooden counterpart. It's a reliable choice for professional soldiers and experienced adventurers.

- AC Bonus: +2 (when Raised)
- Speed Penalty: 0 ft
- Hardness: 5
- HP (BT): 20 (10)

You can use the Raise a Shield action to gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn. This steel shield's superior hardness makes it excellent for the Shield Block reaction, allowing you to reduce more damage before the shield itself takes harm.

entity.name: Studded Leather Armor
entity.summary: Leather armor reinforced with metal studs for enhanced protection.
entity.description:
This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, increasing its protective qualities while still allowing considerable freedom of movement. It's a common choice for light infantry and scouts.

- AC Bonus: +2
- Dex Cap: +3
- Check Penalty: -1
- Speed Penalty: 0 ft
- Strength: 12
- Group: Leather
- Armor Traits: —

Studded leather armor is leather armor with metal studs or spikes embedded in it to provide additional protection without sacrificing too much mobility.

entity.name: Wooden Shield
entity.summary: Basic wooden shield providing affordable defense for beginners.
entity.description:
This simple wooden shield is crafted from wood and sometimes reinforced with metal. It's the most basic and affordable shield option, popular among militia and beginning adventurers.

- AC Bonus: +2 (when Raised)
- Speed Penalty: 0 ft
- Hardness: 3
- HP (BT): 12 (6)

You can use the Raise a Shield action to gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn. This wooden shield can be used with the Shield Block reaction to reduce incoming damage, though it will take damage in the process.

entity.name: Backpack
entity.summary: A sturdy leather pack for carrying equipment.
entity.description: A backpack holds up to 4 Bulk of items. The first 2 Bulk of these items don't count against your Bulk limits.

entity.name: Bedroll
entity.summary: A sleeping bag with a blanket and cushion.
entity.description: A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied. It's suited only for people up to 8 feet tall.

entity.name: Chalk (10 pieces)
entity.summary: Sticks of white chalk for marking surfaces.
entity.description: Chalk can be used to mark surfaces, create temporary symbols, or leave messages. It's particularly useful for marking passages in dungeons or caves to avoid getting lost.

entity.name: Climbing Kit
entity.summary: A collection of tools and equipment for climbing.
entity.description: A climbing kit includes assorted pitons, a small hammer, a grappling hook, and 50 feet of rope. You can use the items in the kit separately, but it's more efficient to keep them together. Using a climbing kit grants you a +1 item bonus to Athletics checks to Climb.

entity.name: Compass
entity.summary: A navigational tool showing magnetic north.
entity.description: A compass helps you navigate in the wilderness. When using a compass, you gain a +1 item bonus to Survival checks to Sense Direction. A compass doesn't work in areas with strong magnetic interference or in places without access to the sky.

entity.name: Crowbar
entity.summary: A metal bar for prying and forcing open doors and containers.
entity.description: When Forcing Open an object that doesn't have an easy grip, a crowbar makes it easier to gain the necessary leverage. Without a crowbar, prying something open takes a –2 item penalty to the Athletics check to Force Open (unless a GM allows you to use a similar tool).

entity.name: Fishing Tackle
entity.summary: Equipment for catching fish including hooks, line, and lures.
entity.description: This kit includes a fishing hook, line, lures, and a simple rod. You can use it to catch fish with the Survival skill. Having fishing tackle grants you a +1 item bonus to Survival checks to Subsist by fishing.

entity.name: Flint and Steel
entity.summary: Tools for striking sparks to start fires.
entity.description: Striking the flint and steel together creates sparks. You can use these sparks to create a fire if you have some tinder or another suitable flammable material handy. It usually takes about 1 minute to light a flame with flint and steel.

entity.name: Grappling Hook
entity.summary: A multi-pronged hook for climbing.
entity.description: You can throw a grappling hook with a rope tied to it to make a climb easier. To anchor a grappling hook, make an attack roll with the secret trait against a DC depending on the target, typically DC 20 for a battleground object and DC 25 for a ledge or structure. On a success, your hook has a firm hold, but on a critical failure, the hook seems like it will hold but actually falls when you're partway up.

entity.name: Hammer
entity.summary: A basic carpentry tool for driving nails and light construction.
entity.description: A basic tool hammer is useful for construction and driving pitons or spikes. It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage.

entity.name: Healer's Tools
entity.summary: A kit containing bandages, herbs, and medical tools.
entity.description: This kit contains bandages, herbs, and surgical tools. You need healer's tools to use Medicine to Treat Wounds. If you wear your healer's tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

entity.name: Lantern (Hooded)
entity.summary: A metal lantern with shutters to control light.
entity.description: A lantern sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius (and dim light to the next 60 feet). It can be shuttered to emit only dim light in a 10-foot radius. A lantern burns for 6 hours on a pint (1/2 liter) of oil.

entity.name: Material Component Pouch
entity.summary: A pouch containing common spell components.
entity.description: A material component pouch contains common spell components that don't have a specific cost. Having one allows you to use the Material Casting action for spells with material components. This pouch is specially organized for quick access during spellcasting.

entity.name: Musical Instrument (Handheld)
entity.summary: A portable musical instrument for performances.
entity.description: This is a common handheld musical instrument such as a flute, lute, or fiddle. You need an instrument to use the Performance skill for musical performances. Handheld instruments are versatile and relatively easy to transport.

entity.name: Oil (Flask)
entity.summary: A flask of oil for lanterns or improvised weapons.
entity.description: You can use oil to fuel lanterns, but you can also use it as a weapon. Splashing a creature with oil is a ranged attack. If the target takes fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), it takes 1d6 persistent fire damage.

entity.name: Piton
entity.summary: A metal spike for securing ropes while climbing.
entity.description: These small spikes can be used as anchors to make climbing easier. To affix a piton, you must hold it in one hand and use a hammer to drive it in with your other hand. You can attach a rope to the hammered-in piton so that you don't fall all the way to the ground on a critical failure while Climbing.

entity.name: Rations (1 week)
entity.summary: A week's worth of dried and preserved food.
entity.description: Rations consist of dried foods that can survive long periods of time without spoiling. This purchase includes enough food for one person for 1 week.

entity.name: Religious Symbol (Wooden)
entity.summary: A holy symbol representing a deity or faith.
entity.description: A religious symbol is a wooden carving or simple pendant representing a deity or religious philosophy. Many divine spellcasters wear their religious symbol visibly to show their devotion. A religious symbol is required as a focus for some divine spells.

entity.name: Rope (50 ft)
entity.summary: A length of strong hemp rope.
entity.description: This length of strong hemp rope is 50 feet long and has 2 Hit Points. A creature can burst it with a DC 17 Athletics check.

entity.name: Sack
entity.summary: A simple cloth or burlap bag for carrying items.
entity.description: A sack can hold up to 8 Bulk of items (though no more than 4 Bulk of this can be items of 1 Bulk or greater, as the rest must be light items). A sack held in two hands can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d2 bludgeoning damage.

entity.name: Soap
entity.summary: A bar of cleaning soap.
entity.description: A bar of soap can be used for personal hygiene and cleaning. It's particularly useful for removing grime, blood, and other substances that might make you more noticeable or uncomfortable.

entity.name: Tent
entity.summary: A portable shelter for outdoor camping.
entity.description: A tent provides cover and concealment from creatures outside the tent. Setting up or taking down a tent requires 10 minutes and 2 hands. Most tents accommodate up to four creatures.

entity.name: Thieves' Tools
entity.summary: Lock picks and tools for bypassing locks and traps.
entity.description: This kit contains tools useful for picking locks and disarming traps. You need thieves' tools to use Thievery to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types). If you wear your thieves' tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

entity.name: Torch
entity.summary: A simple wooden torch that provides light.
entity.description: A torch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet). It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage. A torch burns for 1 hour.

entity.name: Waterskin
entity.summary: A leather container for carrying water or other liquids.
entity.description: A waterskin can hold roughly a half-gallon (2 liters) of liquid. This is enough water to sustain 1 person for 1 day.

entity.name: Writing Set
entity.summary: Ink, quill, and parchment for writing documents.
entity.description: A writing set includes a vial of ink, an inkpen, spare nibs, and parchment. It's used for recording information, copying texts, creating maps, or sending messages. The ink and parchment are enough for roughly 20 pages of writing.

entity.name: Battleaxe
entity.summary: A single-bladed axe dealing 1d8 slashing damage with the sweep trait.
entity.description:
A sturdy axe with a single blade mounted on a wooden haft. The battleaxe is a reliable martial weapon favored by warriors.

- Damage: 1d8 slashing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Axe
- Weapon Traits: sweep

The sweep trait grants you a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against a target if you've already attacked a different target that turn with this weapon, making it excellent for fighting multiple opponents.

entity.name: Club
entity.summary: A simple bludgeoning weapon dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage, throwable up to 10 feet.
entity.description:
A heavy piece of shaped wood used as a simple weapon. Clubs are often improvised from available materials.

- Damage: 1d6 bludgeoning
- Hands: 1
- Group: Club
- Weapon Traits: thrown 10 ft.

The club is one of the simplest weapons available and costs nothing, making it accessible to anyone. Despite its simplicity, it deals respectable damage and can be thrown in a pinch.

entity.name: Crossbow
entity.summary: A mechanical ranged weapon dealing 1d8 piercing damage with 120 foot range.
entity.description:
A mechanical weapon that fires bolts using a trigger mechanism. The crossbow is more powerful and accurate than a bow but takes longer to reload.

- Damage: 1d8 piercing
- Hands: 2
- Group: Bow
- Weapon Traits: range 120 ft., reload 1

The crossbow's excellent range and damage make it a popular choice for guards and hunters. Reload 1 means you must use an Interact action to reload after each shot, limiting your rate of fire.

entity.name: Dagger
entity.summary: A small, versatile blade dealing 1d4 piercing damage, agile and finesse, throwable up to 10 feet.
entity.description:
A lightweight stabbing weapon with a short blade, the dagger is a versatile tool used by rogues, spellcasters, and anyone needing a concealable weapon.

- Damage: 1d4 piercing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Knife
- Weapon Traits: agile, finesse, thrown 10 ft., versatile S

The dagger's agile and finesse traits make it ideal for quick, precise strikes, while its thrown trait allows it to be used at range. The versatile S trait lets you deal slashing damage instead of piercing when advantageous.

entity.name: Fist
entity.summary: Your basic unarmed strike dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage, agile, finesse, and nonlethal.
entity.description:
Everyone has a fist attack that represents punching, kicking, headbutting, or similar unarmed attacks.

- Damage: 1d4 bludgeoning
- Hands: 1
- Group: Brawling
- Weapon Traits: agile, finesse, nonlethal, unarmed

Fists are always available and can't be disarmed. The nonlethal trait means attacks with this weapon deal nonlethal damage by default, allowing you to subdue foes without killing them. The agile and finesse traits make unarmed strikes effective for quick combatants.

entity.name: Gauntlet
entity.summary: An armored glove dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage while keeping your hand free.
entity.description:
A reinforced metal glove worn over the hand. Unlike most weapons, you can hold items in a hand wearing a gauntlet.

- Damage: 1d4 bludgeoning
- Hands: 1
- Group: Brawling
- Weapon Traits: free-hand

The free-hand trait means you can use the hand wearing the gauntlet for other purposes, such as holding items or casting spells with somatic components, while still threatening enemies with the weapon.

entity.name: Glaive
entity.summary: A polearm with a blade dealing 1d8 slashing damage with reach, deadly d8, and forceful.
entity.description:
A long pole with a curved blade mounted at the end. The glaive combines the reach of a polearm with the cutting power of a blade.

- Damage: 1d8 slashing
- Hands: 2
- Group: Polearm
- Weapon Traits: deadly d8, forceful, reach

The reach trait lets you attack enemies 10 feet away. Deadly d8 adds extra damage on critical hits. Forceful means your second attack on a turn deals extra damage if your first hit, and even more on subsequent attacks.

entity.name: Greataxe
entity.summary: A massive two-handed axe dealing 1d12 slashing damage with devastating strikes.
entity.description:
An enormous axe with a large, heavy blade requiring both hands to swing. The greataxe is favored by barbarians and warriors who prioritize raw damage.

- Damage: 1d12 slashing
- Hands: 2
- Group: Axe
- Weapon Traits: sweep

The greataxe deals massive damage with each hit, and the sweep trait makes it effective against multiple foes. Its heavy bulk and two-handed requirement make it unwieldy but devastating.

entity.name: Greatclub
entity.summary: A massive two-handed club dealing 1d10 bludgeoning damage with backswing and shove.
entity.description:
An enormous piece of heavy wood or a tree trunk fashioned into a weapon. The greatclub is a simple but devastating weapon.

- Damage: 1d10 bludgeoning
- Hands: 2
- Group: Club
- Weapon Traits: backswing, shove

The backswing trait grants a bonus to attack on your second attack if your first missed, representing the momentum of your swing. The shove trait allows you to push enemies back. Despite being a simple weapon, the greatclub deals impressive damage.

entity.name: Greatsword
entity.summary: A massive two-handed blade dealing 1d12 slashing damage with impressive reach.
entity.description:
An enormous sword with a blade up to 6 feet long, requiring both hands to wield effectively. The greatsword is favored by warriors who want maximum damage.

- Damage: 1d12 slashing
- Hands: 2
- Group: Sword
- Weapon Traits: versatile P

The greatsword deals the highest base damage of any martial sword and its versatile P trait provides tactical flexibility. However, wielding it requires both hands, preventing you from using a shield.

entity.name: Halberd
entity.summary: A versatile polearm dealing 1d10 piercing damage with reach and versatile slashing.
entity.description:
A long pole with an axe blade mounted on top and a spike on the end. The halberd is a versatile weapon that combines multiple weapon types.

- Damage: 1d10 piercing
- Hands: 2
- Group: Polearm
- Weapon Traits: reach, versatile S

The halberd's reach lets you attack from 10 feet away, while its versatile S trait allows you to deal slashing damage when advantageous. Its higher base damage compared to other reach weapons makes it a popular choice for guards and soldiers.

entity.name: Handwraps of Mighty Blows
entity.summary: Magical cloth wrappings that grant fundamental runes to unarmed attacks.
entity.description:
These cloth wrappings enfold your hands, granting your unarmed attacks the benefits of weapon runes.

- Damage: As unarmed attack
- Hands: -
- Group: Brawling
- Weapon Traits: invested, magical

When you invest these handwraps, they grant their fundamental runes (weapon potency and striking) to all your unarmed attacks. This is essential for martial artists and monks who rely on unarmed strikes. The handwraps don't take up a hand slot.

entity.name: Heavy Crossbow
entity.summary: A powerful crossbow dealing 1d10 piercing damage with excellent range but slow reload.
entity.description:
A large, powerful crossbow that fires heavy bolts with tremendous force. The heavy crossbow sacrifices rate of fire for damage and range.

- Damage: 1d10 piercing
- Hands: 2
- Group: Bow
- Weapon Traits: range 120 ft., reload 2

The heavy crossbow deals excellent damage and has superior range, making it ideal for sniping. However, reload 2 means you must use two Interact actions to reload it, significantly limiting your rate of fire.

entity.name: Javelin
entity.summary: A light throwing spear dealing 1d6 piercing damage with 30 foot throwing range.
entity.description:
A light spear designed specifically for throwing. Javelins are carried in bundles and hurled at enemies.

- Damage: 1d6 piercing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Dart
- Weapon Traits: thrown 30 ft.

The javelin is lighter than a spear (Light bulk vs 1 bulk) and has a better throwing range (30 feet vs 20 feet), making it superior as a thrown weapon. Many warriors carry several javelins to use before closing to melee.

entity.name: Lance
entity.summary: A cavalry weapon dealing 1d8 piercing damage with reach, deadly d8, and jousting.
entity.description:
A long, tapered weapon designed for mounted combat. The lance is most effective when charging on horseback.

- Damage: 1d8 piercing
- Hands: 2
- Group: Spear
- Weapon Traits: deadly d8, jousting d6, reach

The reach trait lets you attack from 10 feet away. Deadly d8 increases critical hit damage. Jousting d6 increases the damage die by one step when charging on a mount, making mounted charges devastating.

entity.name: Light Hammer
entity.summary: A small hammer dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage, agile and throwable up to 20 feet.
entity.description:
A small hammer that can be wielded with one hand or thrown. The light hammer is popular among crafters who need a versatile tool and weapon.

- Damage: 1d6 bludgeoning
- Hands: 1
- Group: Hammer
- Weapon Traits: agile, thrown 20 ft.

The agile trait reduces multiple attack penalties, and the thrown trait gives it ranged versatility. Its light bulk makes it easy to carry multiple light hammers.

entity.name: Longbow
entity.summary: A powerful bow dealing 1d8 piercing damage with 100 foot range and deadly d10.
entity.description:
A tall bow, as long as a person, designed for maximum range and power. The longbow is the weapon of choice for archers.

- Damage: 1d8 piercing
- Hands: 1+
- Group: Bow
- Weapon Traits: deadly d10, propulsive, range 100 ft., reload 0, volley 30 ft.

The deadly d10 trait makes critical hits devastating. Propulsive adds half your Strength modifier to damage. Reload 0 means you can shoot repeatedly. Volley 30 ft. imposes a -2 penalty when attacking targets within 30 feet.

entity.name: Longsword
entity.summary: A versatile martial blade dealing 1d8 slashing damage, or piercing with versatile.
entity.description:
A classic knightly weapon with a straight, double-edged blade about 3 feet long. The longsword is the quintessential martial weapon.

- Damage: 1d8 slashing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Sword
- Weapon Traits: versatile P

The longsword's versatile P trait allows you to deal piercing damage instead of slashing when it would be more effective, such as against armored opponents or creatures with resistance to slashing damage.

entity.name: Mace
entity.summary: A weighted metal head on a handle dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage, capable of shoving foes.
entity.description:
A metal club with a weighted head, the mace is a simple but effective weapon favored by clerics and warriors who need to deal bludgeoning damage.

- Damage: 1d6 bludgeoning
- Hands: 1
- Group: Club
- Weapon Traits: shove

The mace's shove trait allows you to push enemies away from you as part of your attack, making it useful for controlling the battlefield. Its simple design makes it easy to use effectively.

entity.name: Maul
entity.summary: A heavy two-handed hammer dealing 1d12 bludgeoning damage with the shove trait.
entity.description:
A massive hammer with an enormous metal head requiring both hands to swing. The maul is designed to crush armor and bones alike.

- Damage: 1d12 bludgeoning
- Hands: 2
- Group: Hammer
- Weapon Traits: shove

The maul deals the highest base damage among bludgeoning weapons and can shove enemies back. Its bludgeoning damage is particularly effective against constructs and undead vulnerable to crushing attacks.

entity.name: Rapier
entity.summary: A precise thrusting sword dealing 1d6 piercing damage with deadly d8, disarm, and finesse.
entity.description:
A slender, sharply pointed sword designed for thrusting attacks. The rapier is the weapon of choice for duelists and swashbucklers.

- Damage: 1d6 piercing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Sword
- Weapon Traits: deadly d8, disarm, finesse

The deadly d8 trait adds an extra d8 to critical hit damage, making precise strikes devastating. The disarm trait allows you to knock weapons from enemies' hands, and finesse lets you use Dexterity for attacks.

entity.name: Scimitar
entity.summary: A curved sword dealing 1d6 slashing damage with forceful and sweep traits.
entity.description:
A curved blade designed for powerful slashing attacks. The scimitar is favored in desert regions and by cavalry.

- Damage: 1d6 slashing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Sword
- Weapon Traits: forceful, sweep

The forceful trait increases damage on subsequent attacks in a turn, while sweep grants a bonus to hit after attacking a different target. This combination makes the scimitar excellent for fighting multiple opponents.

entity.name: Shortbow
entity.summary: A compact bow dealing 1d6 piercing damage with 60 foot range and deadly d10.
entity.description:
A compact bow suitable for use in confined spaces or on horseback. The shortbow is easier to use than a longbow but has less range.

- Damage: 1d6 piercing
- Hands: 1+
- Group: Bow
- Weapon Traits: deadly d10, range 60 ft., reload 0

The deadly d10 trait adds an extra d10 to damage when you critically hit. Reload 0 means you can fire repeatedly without needing to reload. The shortbow requires one hand to hold and one hand to shoot.

entity.name: Shortsword
entity.summary: A quick, light blade dealing 1d6 piercing damage with agile and finesse traits.
entity.description:
A short blade about 2 feet long, favored by rogues and duelists for its speed and precision. The shortsword is lighter and faster than a longsword.

- Damage: 1d6 piercing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Sword
- Weapon Traits: agile, finesse, versatile S

The agile trait reduces the penalty for multiple attacks, and finesse lets you use Dexterity for attack rolls. The versatile S trait allows you to deal slashing damage when advantageous.

entity.name: Sickle
entity.summary: A curved farming tool dealing 1d4 slashing damage with agile, finesse, and trip.
entity.description:
A curved blade on a short handle, traditionally used for harvesting crops. The sickle makes an effective improvised weapon.

- Damage: 1d4 slashing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Knife
- Weapon Traits: agile, finesse, trip

The sickle's agile and finesse traits make it suitable for quick, dexterous fighters. The trip trait allows you to knock enemies prone, making it useful for setting up attacks by allies.

entity.name: Sling
entity.summary: A simple ranged weapon dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage with 50 foot range, requires reload.
entity.description:
A leather strap used to hurl stones or bullets at enemies. The sling is a simple but effective ranged weapon.

- Damage: 1d6 bludgeoning
- Hands: 1+
- Group: Sling
- Weapon Traits: propulsive, range 50 ft., reload 1

The sling costs nothing and uses easily found ammunition. The propulsive trait adds half your Strength modifier to damage (minimum 0). Reload 1 means you must use an Interact action to reload after each shot.

entity.name: Spear
entity.summary: A piercing polearm dealing 1d6 piercing damage, throwable up to 20 feet.
entity.description:
A simple weapon consisting of a sharpened point mounted on a wooden shaft. The spear is one of humanity's oldest weapons.

- Damage: 1d6 piercing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Spear
- Weapon Traits: thrown 20 ft.

The spear is versatile and inexpensive, making it a popular choice for militia and guards. Its thrown range of 20 feet is better than most melee weapons, allowing you to engage enemies at range before they close to melee.

entity.name: Staff
entity.summary: A long wooden pole dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage, or 1d8 when wielded in two hands.
entity.description:
A long, straight piece of wood used as both a walking aid and a weapon. The staff is a favored weapon of monks and wizards.

- Damage: 1d4 bludgeoning (1d8 two-handed)
- Hands: 1
- Group: Club
- Weapon Traits: two-hand d8

The staff costs nothing and can be found almost anywhere. While it deals modest damage in one hand, wielding it with both hands increases its damage die to 1d8, making it surprisingly effective.

entity.name: Starknife
entity.summary: A star-shaped blade dealing 1d4 piercing damage with agile, deadly d6, finesse, and thrown.
entity.description:
A multi-pointed blade shaped like a star that can be wielded in melee or thrown. The starknife is favored by followers of Desna.

- Damage: 1d4 piercing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Knife
- Weapon Traits: agile, deadly d6, finesse, thrown 20 ft., versatile S

The starknife combines excellent traits: agile and finesse for accuracy, deadly d6 for critical hits, thrown for range, and versatile S for flexibility. Despite its low base damage, these traits make it surprisingly effective.

entity.name: Trident
entity.summary: A three-pronged spear dealing 1d8 piercing damage, throwable up to 20 feet.
entity.description:
A long weapon with three prongs at the tip, traditionally associated with fishing and sea deities. The trident is similar to a spear but deadlier.

- Damage: 1d8 piercing
- Hands: 1
- Group: Spear
- Weapon Traits: thrown 20 ft.

The trident deals more damage than a simple spear and maintains the same throwing range, making it a superior choice for those proficient in martial weapons. It's particularly favored by aquatic fighters.

entity.name: Warhammer
entity.summary: A martial hammer dealing 1d8 bludgeoning damage, capable of shoving enemies.
entity.description:
A metal-headed hammer designed for combat, heavier and more robust than a simple mace. The warhammer is effective against armored foes.

- Damage: 1d8 bludgeoning
- Hands: 1
- Group: Hammer
- Weapon Traits: shove

The warhammer deals respectable damage and its shove trait allows you to push enemies away. Bludgeoning damage is particularly effective against skeletons and other creatures resistant to slashing or piercing.

entity.name: Bag of Holding (Type I)
entity.summary: A bag that holds far more than its size suggests.
entity.description:
Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions.

Usage: held in 2 hands
Bulk: 1

The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The space inside the bag can hold up to 25 Bulk of items. This bag has an extradimensional space that holds up to 4 cubic feet. If the bag is overloaded, or if a sharp object pierces it or tears it, the bag ruptures and is ruined, and all the contents spill out into the Astral Plane. If anyone places a bag of holding inside an extradimensional space, both the bag and the space are destroyed, and everything inside is lost forever.

Activate: Interact
Effect: You draw an item from the bag or place an item inside. Searching the bag for a specific item requires an Interact action per item already in the bag.

entity.name: Boots of Elvenkind
entity.summary: Soft boots that muffle your footsteps.
entity.description:
These soft boots are made of supple leather and appear to have been crafted by elven artisans. They conform perfectly to your feet and muffle your footsteps.

Usage: worn shoes
Bulk: L

These boots give you a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks and you can move at full Speed while using the Avoid Notice exploration activity.

entity.name: Bracers of Armor
entity.summary: Bracers that grant a +1 item bonus to AC when unarmored.
entity.description:
These stiff leather bracers are embossed with mystical symbols and grant you power to deflect blows.

Usage: worn bracers
Bulk: L

These bracers grant you a +1 item bonus to AC if you're not wearing armor. This bonus increases by 1 for every 5 levels (to a maximum of +3 at 15th level). If you're wearing armor, you gain no benefit from the bracers, but you can still etch fundamental and property runes onto them as normal for bracers.

entity.name: Climbing Bolt
entity.summary: A bolt that affixes itself to a surface and creates a rope.
entity.description:
This steel bolt is etched with transmutation runes and has a thick eyelet at its base.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Interact

You toss the bolt at a surface within 60 feet. It flies directly to the target location and affixes itself with a loud click. It can support up to 4,000 pounds of weight. Once the bolt is affixed, a 60-foot-long rope appears, hanging from the bolt's eyelet. The rope is the same strength and has the same statistics as a typical adventuring rope. Both the bolt and rope last for 8 hours, after which they disappear.

entity.name: Cloak of Elvenkind
entity.summary: A cloak that grants a bonus to Stealth checks.
entity.description:
This cloak is made of finely woven green cloth and appears to have leaves and vines woven into it. When worn, it shifts its colors and patterns to blend with the surrounding environment.

Usage: worn cloak
Bulk: L

When you wear this cloak, you gain a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks. You can also activate the cloak for a greater effect.

Activate: Interact
Frequency: once per day
Effect: You pull the cloak's hood up and gain the effects of an invisibility spell for 1 minute or until you use a hostile action, whichever comes first. The cloak doesn't grant a bonus to Stealth during this time, as the spell's invisibility is sufficient.

entity.name: Elixir of Life (Minor)
entity.summary: An alchemical elixir that restores 1d6 Hit Points.
entity.description:
Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you gain the listed number of Hit Points.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Interact

Drinking this elixir restores 1d6 Hit Points and grants you a +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

entity.name: Feather Token (Bird)
entity.summary: A token that becomes a bird messenger.
entity.description:
Each feather token is a miniature craft encoded with magical power. When activated, this token transforms into a bird to deliver a message.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Activate: Interact

You activate this feather token by writing or speaking a message (of 25 words or fewer) and the name of a recipient, then releasing the feather into the air. The feather becomes a Tiny bird that flies at a Speed of 60 feet toward the recipient, and the bird seeks out the named recipient for up to 24 hours, traveling any distance and even across planes if necessary. The bird delivers its message when it reaches the recipient, and the recipient can send a response back with the bird immediately (a message of 25 words or fewer) before the bird vanishes. The bird can always find the recipient, even if they're using magic to hide, though physical barriers can still prevent the bird from reaching them.

entity.name: Hat of Disguise
entity.summary: A hat that allows you to change your appearance.
entity.description:
This ordinary-looking hat allows you to cloak yourself in illusions.

Usage: worn headwear

When you invest this hat, you either increase or decrease your size by one size category or change the details of your appearance. This can't change your general shape or body type, but it can alter coloration, sound, and other cosmetic effects. This alteration is an illusion, so creatures that disbelieve the illusion see you as you truly are.

Activate: Interact
Frequency: once per day
Effect: You cast illusory disguise on yourself. The spell lasts until your next daily preparations.

entity.name: Potency Rune (+1 Armor)
entity.summary: A fundamental rune that grants a +1 item bonus to AC.
entity.description:
Magical enhancements make this armor more effective. A potency rune is what makes armor magic armor.

Usage: etched onto armor

An item can have only one fundamental rune of each type, though it can have any number of property runes. A +1 armor potency rune grants a +1 item bonus to AC. If you're wearing armor without a potency rune, you can upgrade it by etching a potency rune on it with the Craft activity.

entity.name: Potency Rune (+1 Weapon)
entity.summary: A fundamental rune that grants a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.
entity.description:
Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. A potency rune is what makes a weapon a magic weapon or armor magic armor.

Usage: etched onto a weapon

An item can have only one fundamental rune of each type, though it can have any number of property runes. A +1 weapon potency rune gives you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon and increases the weapon's number of damage dice by one for all your Strikes with that weapon.

entity.name: Potion of Healing (Lesser)
entity.summary: A lesser healing potion that restores 2d8+5 Hit Points.
entity.description:
This ruby-red potion restores vitality to those who drink it.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Interact

Drinking a potion of healing restores 2d8+5 Hit Points. You gain the maximum benefit from this potion when you drink the entire potion at once.

entity.name: Potion of Healing (Minor)
entity.summary: A minor healing potion that restores 1d8 Hit Points.
entity.description:
This ruby-red potion restores vitality to those who drink it.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Interact

Drinking a potion of healing restores 1d8 Hit Points. You gain the maximum benefit from this potion when you drink the entire potion at once.

entity.name: Potion of Healing (Moderate)
entity.summary: A moderate healing potion that restores 3d8+10 Hit Points.
entity.description:
This ruby-red potion restores vitality to those who drink it.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Interact

Drinking a potion of healing restores 3d8+10 Hit Points. You gain the maximum benefit from this potion when you drink the entire potion at once.

entity.name: Resilient Rune
entity.summary: A fundamental rune that grants a +1 item bonus to saving throws.
entity.description:
Resilient runes imbue armor with additional protective magic. A resilient rune grants a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

Usage: etched onto armor

A resilient rune grants you a +1 item bonus to saving throws. You can upgrade a resilient rune already etched on a suit of armor to a greater version, increasing the values by 1.

entity.name: Ring of Sustenance
entity.summary: A ring that reduces your need for food and sleep.
entity.description:
This polished wooden ring constantly refreshes your body and mind. You don't need to eat or drink while wearing this ring.

Usage: worn ring

You don't need to eat or drink while wearing this ring. You only need to rest for 2 hours per day to gain the benefits of 8 hours of rest. This doesn't allow you to prepare more than once per day or regain your resources more quickly. You still need to spend 10 minutes winding down before sleeping, and if you rest any longer than 2 hours, you gain the normal benefits of resting for that longer period.

entity.name: Scroll of Heal (1st-Rank)
entity.summary: A scroll containing the heal spell at 1st rank.
entity.description:
This parchment scroll contains a single casting of the heal spell.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Cast a Spell

Activating a scroll requires Casting the Spell at the spell's rank. You must have the spell on your spell list to activate the scroll. If you do, you can cast it even if you don't have spell slots remaining or if the spell isn't prepared.

Casting a spell from a scroll requires material, somatic, and verbal components. The scroll is destroyed after being activated. You can use a scroll even if the spell is of a higher rank than you can normally cast, but you must succeed at a counteract check to do so.

This scroll casts heal at 1st rank, restoring 1d8 Hit Points to a living creature within 30 feet. If you have fewer than maximum Hit Points and cast heal targeting yourself, you restore an additional 1d8 Hit Points.

entity.name: Scroll of Magic Missile (1st-Rank)
entity.summary: A scroll containing the magic missile spell at 1st rank.
entity.description:
This parchment scroll contains a single casting of the magic missile spell.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Cast a Spell

Activating a scroll requires Casting the Spell at the spell's rank. You must have the spell on your spell list to activate the scroll. If you do, you can cast it even if you don't have spell slots remaining or if the spell isn't prepared.

Casting a spell from a scroll requires material, somatic, and verbal components. The scroll is destroyed after being activated. You can use a scroll even if the spell is of a higher rank than you can normally cast, but you must succeed at a counteract check to do so.

This scroll casts magic missile at 1st rank, firing three missiles that each deal 1d4+1 force damage to targets within 120 feet.

entity.name: Striking Rune
entity.summary: A fundamental rune that increases weapon damage dice.
entity.description:
A striking rune stores extra magical power in your weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one.

Usage: etched onto a weapon

A striking rune etched onto a weapon increases the number of weapon damage dice it deals to two. For instance, a +1 striking dagger would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.

This benefit doesn't apply to other dice a weapon adds, such as precision damage, versatile damage, or a fatal die increase. A weapon can have only one striking rune at a time.

entity.name: Wand of Heal (1st-Rank)
entity.summary: A wand that can cast heal at 1st rank.
entity.description:
This simple wooden wand is carved with holy symbols and glows with a soft white light when activated.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Cast a Spell
Frequency: once per day, plus overcharge

You cast heal at 1st rank. You restore 1d8 Hit Points to a living creature within 30 feet. If you have fewer than maximum Hit Points and cast heal targeting yourself, you restore an additional 1d8 Hit Points. The spell has the somatic and verbal components.

Overcharge: You can attempt to overcharge the wand by activating it even if you've already done so that day. This requires a DC 10 flat check. On a success, you cast the spell normally. On a failure, the spell is not cast, the charge is wasted, and you can't activate the wand again until your next daily preparations.

entity.name: Wand of Magic Missile (1st-Rank)
entity.summary: A wand that can cast magic missile at 1st rank.
entity.description:
This wand is carved from rowan wood and tipped with a gleaming crystal that glows with arcane energy.

Usage: held in 1 hand
Bulk: L
Activate: Cast a Spell
Frequency: once per day, plus overcharge

You cast magic missile at 1st rank. The spell fires three missiles that each deal 1d4+1 force damage to a target of your choice within 120 feet.

Overcharge: You can attempt to overcharge the wand by activating it even if you've already done so that day. This requires a DC 10 flat check. On a success, you cast the spell normally. On a failure, the spell is not cast, the charge is wasted, and you can't activate the wand again until your next daily preparations.
